conclusion: The v-t graph shows the magnitude of the sky-diver's velocity steadily increasing from 0 s to 10 s.
The slope of the curve is positive all the way to the peak at 10 s.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
A positive slope means the acceleration vector points in the same direction as the chosen positive velocity direction.
During free-fall, the direction is downward since gravity acts downward and exceeds air-resistance during this early portion of the descent.
During the 0 s to 10 s interval, the sky-diver's acceleration is directed downward.
